cheatsheet.title: Generating an EMF Model using Annotated Java

intro.description: This cheat sheet is a step-by-step description of generating an EMF model and model editor using annotated Java.

cheatsheet.onCompletion: Congratulations you have succesfully created an EMF model from Java interfaces and class, generated the code, and created instances of the model.

item.title: Set Up the Environment
item.description:
Your environment must be set up so you can perform the steps of this cheat sheet.
Delete or rename the following projects if they exist in your workspace:"library.java","library.java.edit","library.java.editor"

item.title: Create a New Empty EMF Project
item.description: First, you should create a new library.java empty EMF project.

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project...". Then, expand "Eclipse Modeling Framework", select "Empty EMF Models" and click "Next".
Type the project name "library.java", then click "Finish".

item.title: Create New Java Interfaces and Class
item.description:
Now, you should be able to create interfaces and class in your library.java project. The library.java project consists of three Java interfaces and a Java class: a library interface, a writer interface, a book interface, and a book category class.
In this step you will create three interfaces and a class. Click on (?) to view their implementation.

subitem.label: Create the BookCategory class.
Create the Library interface.
Create the Writer interface.
Create the Book interface.

item.title: Create a New EMF Model
item.description: In order to generate the model from the interfaces and class, a new EMF Model must be created.

subitem.label: Right-click the "src" folder and select "New->Other..." from the pop-up menu. Then, expand "Eclipse Modeling Framework", select "EMF Models" and click "Next".
Change the parent folder to "library.java/model".
Change the file name to "library.genmodel", then click "Next".
Select "Annotated Java", then click "Next".
Select the "library" package, then click "Finish".

item.title: Generate the EMF Model and Editor Code
item.description: Before the code can be ran by Eclipse the EMF Model and Editor Code must be generated and compiled.

subitem.label: In the generator, right click on "Library" and select "Generate ${this} Code".
If project is not build automatically, then select "Project->Build All" to compile the generated code.
Click on "src-> folder and select "Source->Organize Imports" to remove unused imports.

item.title: Run the Generated Editor
item.description: Now, you are set to run the generated editor to created new library models.

subitem.label: Select "Run->Run As->Eclipse Application" to run a new instance of Eclipse with the newly generated editor.
Create a general project: "librarytest".
Right click "librarytest" and select "New->Other...".
Expand "Example EMF Model Creation Wizards" and select "Library Model". Then, click "Next".
Enter "My.library" as filename, then click "Next".
Select "Library" as model object, then click "Finish".
In "Resource Set", expand "platform:/resource/librarytest/My.library". Right click "Library" and select "New Child->Writer" to create a Writer object in Library model.
